intro: Jasione bialis, commonly known as lesser jasione, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, blue to purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces a cluster of flowers at the top of its stem. Jasione bialis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in various conditions.
